title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.7 - Executive Order No. 7: Ordering a moratorium on proposed rules and regulations. [*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.7 - Executive Order No. 7: Ordering a moratorium on proposed rules and regulations. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, excessive rules and regulations have unduly
burdened the State's economy and imposed needless costs on the businesses and
citizens of this State; and
WHEREAS, this administration intends to continue to review
all proposed rules and regulations to ensure that no rule or regulation is more
demanding than required to meet legislative goals; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby continue Executive Order No. 2 in full
force and effect up to and including June 30, 1995. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: April 5, 1995

Footnotes
*
[Revoked by Executive Order

No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra. ] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra. ] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra. ]

5.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
